byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal, Ahmad Shakib and an employee of The New York Times contributed reporting. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

abstract: Taliban's resurgence in Afghanistan as well as its takeover of city of Kunduz has cemented status of Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour as one of most formidable opponents to American interests in decades; Mansour remains something of mystery to Afghan and American officials and it is unclear what path he will chart as leader of Taliban.
lead_paragraph: Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour has become central to the Taliban’s revival as a powerful insurgency that poses a grave threat to the Afghan government.

headline.main: Taliban’s New Leader Strengthens His Hold With Intrigue and Battlefield Victory
headline.print_headline: Intrigue Fuels Rise of Leader of the Taliban

snippet: Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour has become central to the Taliban’s revival as a powerful insurgency that poses a grave threat to the Afghan government.
